introduction:
Ananas macrodontes is a plant species closely related to the pineapple, in the family Bromeliaceae.[4] Its common name is the false pineapple,[5] a name shared with the not closely related Pandanus kaida.[6] There is no consensus whether this species should belong in the same genus as the pineapple (Ananas), or in its own genus (Pseudananas).[4][3]

It is native to central South America (Brazil, Bolivia, Paraguay, Ecuador, northern Argentina).[1]
